title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe break down in tears
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing’s Catherine Tyldesley and her partner Johannes Radebe cried as they talked about being eliminated from the competition on It Takes Two.

The couple, who were kicked out from the competition after losing out to Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance-off, both reached for the tissues to wipe their eyes as they talked about their time on the series with Rylan Clark-Neal.

‘She [Catherine] wanted more from me every day, she encouraged me and like I said in the final stages I became the student and she was like the teacher,’ Johannes said.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’ll forever be grateful for this moment. I’m so glad our paths crossed, forever and always my friend.’

‘I’m gutted. I kind of thought – hoped – that we had a couple of weeks left,’ Catherine added. ‘I struggled with the Cha Cha, it was evil.’

Catherine wiped her eye (Picture: BBC)

Emotions ran high (Picture: BBC)

Rylan then played the pair a compilation of their Strictly journey and it sent Catherine over the edge.

‘I can clearly see you’re both emotional, but how does it feel watching all of that back?’ Rylan asked. ‘Did it seem like a blur? Did you even remember it?’

‘It’s just sent me off the edge,’ Catherine admitted as she wiped her eye.

Viewers were also in bits over Catherine and Johannes’ emotions and raced to Twitter to comment, with one writing: ‘Oh dear. I’ve gone again @jojo_radebe is such a sweetheart and a delight as well as a fabulous dancer.

‘Seeing him upset is so sad I’ll miss him.’

Echoing a similar sentiment, another posted: ‘Aw Cath and Jojo’ followed by a string of crying emojis.

Elsewhere on tonight’s It Takes Two, Saffron Baker revealed she sustained not one, but two injuries during training with AJ Pritchard.

It Takes Two continues tomorrow at 6.30pm on BBC Two.
description: Strictly Come Dancing's Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe break down in tears on It Takes Two.
